name: The Garrison (Bermondsey)
short_title: Seafood-led gastropub with standout Sunday roasts
summary: The Garrison is a polished, food-forward gastropub just south of London Bridge that consistently punches above its pub exterior. Diners highlight serious cooking—especially seafood and Sunday roasts—served in a relaxed neighbourhood setting. With a strong service culture and an open, welcoming vibe, it suits celebratory dinners, long roasts, or casual drinks that turn into a full meal.
what_diners_love: Exceptional food quality that feels restaurant-level rather than pub fare
Seafood focus with fresh fish, oysters, scallops and daily specials
One of the best Sunday roasts in the area with generous portions and strong execution
Attentive, personable service (staff and chefs often named)
Thoughtful dietary accommodation including vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free dishes
Great atmosphere: lively but comfortable with booths, bar seating and terrace options
popular_dishes: Sunday roast (beef, pork belly with crackling, vegetarian options)
Fish & chips (noted for distinctive layered chips)
atmosphere_experience: A smart gastropub feel with genuine warmth. Indoors is cosy and bustling; outdoor seating is popular in warmer months. Service is polished without being formal. It can get busy and noisy at peak times—especially weekends and Sundays—which adds to the buzz but may not suit those seeking a quiet meal.
good_to_know: Sunday roast is a major draw and books up quickly
Seafood lovers will be happiest, though meat and vegetarian options are strong too
Portion sizes vary: roasts are generous while some starters feel more refined
Reservations recommended for evenings, weekends and Sundays
Occasional service hiccups reported during very busy periods, but management responses are proactive
Dog-friendly and family-friendly; staff often accommodate prams and children
best_for: Gastropub lovers who care about food
top_tip: For a first visit, go on a Sunday for the roast or ask to see the fresh fish selection—both are repeatedly highlighted as reasons people return.
